title: AI Agent / Automation Specialist for B2B Lead Discovery, Email & SMS Outreach
description:
Job Description

We’re building Forti, a premium, security-first transportation platform. We partner with transportation companies, private security firms, and rental car agencies as service providers.

We’re looking for an AI Agent / Automation Specialist who can design and implement a working automation system within one week.

This system will:
	1.	Discover and qualify relevant companies
	2.	Collect verified contact information
	3.	Send initial email and SMS outreach (where applicable)
	4.	Output everything into a clean Excel / Google Sheets tracking system
	5.	Hand off warm leads to a human VA for phone follow-up

This is a build-first, speed-critical role.

⸻

Timeline Requirement (Very Important)
	•	Initial working version required within 7 days
	•	Must deliver a functional system, not just scripts or research
	•	Iteration and optimization can continue after the first week

If you cannot build and deploy quickly, this role is not a fit.

⸻

What You’ll Be Responsible For

Lead Discovery & Qualification
	•	Rapidly build an AI-driven workflow to identify:
	•	Transportation / chauffeur companies
	•	Private security firms
	•	Rental car agencies
	•	Filter by geography, company type, and legitimacy
	•	Avoid low-quality or irrelevant results

⸻

Contact Data Collection
	•	Automatically gather and validate:
	•	Company name
	•	Website
	•	Emails
	•	Phone numbers
	•	SMS-capable numbers (when available)
	•	Deduplicate and validate data quality

⸻

Automated Outreach
	•	Send initial outreach via:
	•	Email
	•	SMS (where compliant and applicable)
	•	Personalize messages at scale
	•	Avoid repeat or spammy outreach
	•	Respect basic compliance best practices (CAN-SPAM, SMS consent basics)

⸻

Tracking & VA Handoff
	•	Deliver a clear Excel / Google Sheets tracking file with:
	•	Company details
	•	Contact info
	•	Outreach status
	•	Responses / notes
	•	Structure the sheet so a VA can immediately begin calling

⸻

What We’re Looking For

Required
	•	Proven experience building AI agents or automation systems
	•	Comfortable delivering production-ready workflows quickly
	•	Strong with tools such as:
	•	Python or Node
	•	Zapier / Make
	•	OpenAI / LLM-based agents
	•	Email APIs (SendGrid, Mailgun, etc.)
	•	SMS APIs (Twilio or similar)
	•	Ability to document the system clearly for handoff

⸻

Strong Plus
	•	Experience with B2B outreach automation
	•	Experience in transportation, security, or logistics
	•	Prior work with marketplace or platform onboarding
	•	Understanding of basic outreach compliance

⸻

Deliverables (Within 7 Days)
	•	Functional AI-driven lead discovery system
	•	Automated email + SMS outreach live
	•	Clean, usable tracking sheet for VA follow-up
	•	Short documentation or walkthrough explaining the system

⸻

Compensation
	•	Project-based or hourly (open to discussion)
	•	Willing to pay for speed, quality, and reliability
	•	Opportunity for ongoing work after initial delivery

⸻

How to Apply

Please include:
	1.	A brief overview of your AI automation experience
	2.	Examples of systems you’ve built quickly
	3.	Tools you would use to deliver this in under 7 days
	4.	Your availability over the next week

⸻

Why This Role Matters

This system will power Forti’s partner acquisition engine, and speed matters.

title: AI/ML RAG Developer/Engineer
description:
We're looking for an expert AI/ML RAG Developer/Engineer who can build our customer intelligence agent.

Also ability strong AI/ML API integration knowledge is beneficial.

We can setup all the environments and services, but would like you (the expert) to;

-review our schemas, tech stack and plan
-suggest changes or improvements if needed
-build and test the agent
-connect it to our existing web application

and possibly, continue on to build the first versions of the other agents which will interact with this agent.

Architecture (what we are implementing)

### Layer 1 — Clients
- User → Web Client / Mobile Client → API Gateway (auth + rate limit)

### Layer 2 — Central AI Brain
- **Preference Intelligence Engine (PIE)**: Orchestrator + RAG + merging + response formatting

### Layer 3 — Preference/Context Store
- MongoDB Atlas Structured (user prefs JSON)
- MongoDB Atlas Vector Search (preference summary vectors)
- Audit Log (preference_events)
- Redis cache (optional)

### Layer 4 — Specialized Sub-Agents
Connect to:
- 4 different specialized agents.
(Adapters that call your existing module APIs and return candidates.)

### Layer 5 — Business Modules/APIs
- Agent 1 API, A2 API, A3 API, A4 API
 (Existing app logic—PIE plugs into these.)
 
### Layer 6 — Supporting Services
- Policy Guardrails (PII + schema + safety)
- Shared State Manager (session memory / preference bundle builder)
- Async Pipeline: Preferences Service → Queue → Worker → Embeddings API + LLM API → MongoDB Vector

Please submit your resume, examples of similar builds and your availability.

We need you to work within US business hours, and this can expand to full time position. Freelancer preferred. No open time and materials contracts for now.

Thank you.

title: AI Systems Specialist Needed to Configure Marblism AI Team for Local Media & Sales Business
description:
I’m looking for an experienced AI systems specialist to fully configure and customize a Marblism AI workspace for my business.

We operate two related brands:
	•	WorcesterCountyNews.com (local media & community platform)
	•	WorcesterCountyTrusted.com (exclusive trusted partner program for local businesses)

Marblism is already set up with multiple AI roles (Executive Assistant, Sales Associate, Social Media Manager, Blog Writer, Receptionist), but I need someone to properly train and configure each role so they function like a real internal team.

This is not a basic prompt-writing task. I’m looking for someone who understands sales workflows, role-based AI systems, and how to translate a business model into clear AI instructions.

Scope of Work
	•	Configure system instructions for each AI role
	•	Train the Sales Associate on our Trusted Partner offer, qualification rules, and exclusivity model
	•	Align tone and messaging across all roles (local, credible, sales-focused)
	•	Create shared business context so all agents stay consistent
	•	Test outputs and refine responses
	•	Provide light documentation or handoff notes

⸻

Ideal Experience
	•	Experience setting up AI agents or role-based AI teams
	•	Background in sales ops, rev ops, or marketing ops
	•	Comfortable working with AI tools like Marblism, ChatGPT, GoHighLevel, or similar
	•	Strong written communication and attention to detail

⸻

To Apply

Please include:
	1.	A brief example of a similar AI or automation setup you’ve done
	2.	How you approach training AI for sales and business workflows
	3.	Your estimated timeline and fixed price for this setup

⸻

Budget

Open to a fixed-price project. Quality and experience matter more than speed. Our budget is up to $1,000 for this does NOT mean we are looking to spend the entire budget on this project.

title: SIP/VoIP Expert — Build SIP Infrastructure + Bridge RTP ↔ WebSocket Audio (AI Voice Agent)
description:
Overview
We have an AI Voice Agent that does real-time, bidirectional audio streaming via WebSocket. We currently do not have SIP infrastructure and need an expert to build it.

Our customers already have phone systems (PBX/SIP and/or CCaaS). We want our AI agent to integrate into their environment so their existing routing/dialing rules, caller ID policies, and call logic remain unchanged. The AI agent should behave like a human agent seat/endpoint.

What You’ll Do
Design and implement a production-ready SIP stack (your recommended tech: 
- FreeSWITCH/Asterisk/Kamailio/OpenSIPS/SBC, etc.)
- Build a gateway to bridge SIP/RTP ↔ our WebSocket audio stream (low-latency two-way audio)
- Support core call flows: inbound/outbound, DTMF, hold/resume, transfer (REFER/re-INVITE), call state events
- Provide reusable customer integration patterns (SIP trunk and/or registration/extension—recommend best approach)

Deliverables
- Working SIP infra + SIP↔WebSocket gateway (tested end-to-end)
- Short architecture doc + deployment/config checklist
- Customer integration runbook + troubleshooting guide
- Knowledge transfer walkthrough

Required
- Strong SIP + RTP/media skills, vendor interoperability experience
- Debugging with pcaps/Wireshark/sngrep

title: Real Estate Database Development for Sale and Income/Expense Comps
description:
We are seeking an experienced professional to develop a comprehensive real estate database that includes both sale comparable data and income/expense comparable data based on property type, location, date, size, etc. The database should aggregate data from both public and private sources, ensuring accuracy and relevancy. It must be designed to be user-friendly, allowing for easy importing, searching and exporting of data. The goal is to have this connected with AI search tools and AI fill tools to allow for automation that is then able to be confirmed as accurate.
We currently have our database scattered between binders and multiple excel docs and lack a single location for the pimary source. We need this brough to 2026 standards. Intended to be an in house tool, but possible to be sellable in the future.
If you have a proven track record in real estate data management and possess the skills to create a robust database, we would love to hear from you.

title: GoHighLevel AI Voice & Workflow Consultant for Healthcare
description:
Job Title
GoHighLevel AI Voice & Workflow Consultant (Healthcare / Medical Practice)
Job Description
We are a multi-provider podiatry practice implementing an AI-powered front desk and workflow system using GoHighLevel.
We are looking for an experienced GoHighLevel consultant who has hands-on experience building AI voice agents and complex workflows, ideally for medical or regulated businesses.
This is not a basic funnel, SMS, or marketing automation project.
This is a workflow engineering + operations build.
Scope of Work (Phased)
Phase 1 – AI Front Desk (Inbound Calls)
Configure AI voice agent to answer inbound calls
New vs existing patient classification
Create new contacts automatically
Route callers based on intent (new patient, cancel, reschedule, billing, etc.)
Create tasks and pipeline entries for staff
Manual human scheduling (EMR remains source of truth)
AI confirmation callback with voicemail + SMS + email
Phase 2 – Established Patient Workflows
Appointment cancellations
Reschedule requests
Insurance updates
Billing inquiries
Prescription refill requests (routing only, no approvals)
Results inquiries (routing only)
Non-patient calls (vendors, pharmacies, referrals)
Phase 3 – Urgent Post-Op Escalation
Detect urgent post-op issues via AI
Safety disclaimers (no clinical advice)
Structured intake of minimal details
Immediate escalation to provider via text/call/email
Internal high-priority task creation
After-hours logic and failsafes
VERY IMPORTANT REQUIREMENTS (Please Read Carefully)
You are a good fit only if:
You have built AI voice workflows in GoHighLevel, not just chat or SMS
You understand human-in-the-loop design (AI routes, humans decide)
You are comfortable working with medical practices
You understand HIPAA concepts (minimum necessary, no clinical decision automation)
You do NOT propose direct EMR integration or automatic calendar syncing
You can provide proof of prior work (screen share, demo, workflow diagrams, or recordings)
What This Project Is NOT
❌ Not a funnel-only build
❌ Not basic SMS automations
❌ Not “AI that replaces staff”
❌ Not clinical decision-making
❌ Not a generic GHL template
Deliverables
Fully built GoHighLevel workflows (Phases 1–3)
AI voice scripts (inbound, outbound, voicemail)
SMS and email templates
Pipeline and task logic
Testing & QA
Documentation / SOP for staff
Knowledge transfer / handoff session
How We Will Evaluate You
Please answer the following in your proposal:
Describe a GoHighLevel AI voice workflow you have personally built.
(What did it do? What was complex about it?)
Have you worked with medical, dental, or other regulated clients?
If yes, describe how you handled compliance boundaries.
How do you prevent AI from making clinical or coverage decisions?
How would you handle an urgent post-op patient calling after hours?
(Step-by-step, high level is fine.)
What proof can you show of similar work?
(Screen share, diagrams, demo, recordings, etc.)
Proposals that do not answer these questions will not be considered.
Budget & Engagement
We expect this to be a fixed-price, phased project
Estimated total budget: $6,000 – $12,000 depending on experience
We prefer:
Clear scope
Phase-based delivery
Defined acceptance criteria
Long-Term Opportunity
This system is being built as a repeatable model for other podiatry practices.
The right consultant may be considered for ongoing work or future rollouts.
Final Note
We value clarity, judgment, and execution over hype.
If you are thoughtful about what AI should not do, you’ll fit right in.

title: Independent full-stack developer to stabilize and deploy an existing AI-powered web app.

title: RPA / Automation Engineer (Python + AI Agents) — 1-month contract (Google, Kafka, S3, Redshift, etc)
description:
Title: RPA / Automation Engineer (Python + AI Agents) — 1-month contract (Google Workspace, Kafka, S3, Redshift, Jira, Zendesk, Zoho)

We’re a Voice AI company hiring a freelancer to build code-first automations across Ops Engineering + Finance. Many workflows are manual and spreadsheet-based (Google Sheets/Excel). We want production-ready automations shipped weekly (bug-free and deployable as soon as finished).

Stack/Systems: Google Workspace, Kafka, S3, Amazon Redshift, Jira, Zendesk, Zoho CRM, Presto One (internal), Hex (nice-to-have).
Preference: code-first integrations; open to Zapier for basic trigger/routing automations.

Engagement structure (important)

This is intended as a 1-month contract, but Week 1 is a paid trial.

At the end of Week 1, we will decide whether to continue for Weeks 2–4 based on the quality and production readiness of the deliverables.

Delivery expectations

Week 1 (must ship): “Unified Ticket + Issue Intelligence” workflow (details below) plus 2–3 smaller automations

Weeks 2–4 (if continuing): ship additional automations weekly

Target 12–15 total automations in the month

Weekly demo + written update (what shipped, what’s next, risks/blockers)

Week 1 priority build (must ship)

Tickets intelligence: Connect Jira ↔ Zendesk ↔ Presto One ↔ Zoho, unify/normalize records, land artifacts in S3, curate in Redshift, run AI to:

generate a consistent unique tag taxonomy for issues

identify trends across sources (errors + purchasing behavior signals)

detect anomalies (e.g., broken sessions/tags, missing automated tags)

write-back tags/links + weekly digest
Zapier for basic Jira → Zendesk routing is acceptable; overall solution should be code-first and auditable.

Reply on the platform with: 2–3 relevant examples, your week-by-week plan (how you’ll ship Week 1 + reach 12–15 total), availability, rate, and how you handle idempotency/retries + AI guardrails.

title: Odoo 19 AI Agents Architect Needed for Logistics and Sales in Venezuela
description:
I run Odoo 19 with Venezuela localization and I want to design and implement a system of 5 AI Agents (Odoo AI Agents) that can execute real processes inside my database with business rules, proper permissions, auditability, and human approvals where needed.

I’m looking for a senior Odoo 19 expert (bonus if you have hands-on experience with Odoo AI Agents / automation) to lead the architecture and deliver an MVP that can scale.

Important: All pre-contract communication will stay on Upwork (policy compliance). The technical WhatsApp integration itself is part of the project scope.

Goal

Build a multi-agent system that:

Understands our operations (logistics, sales, credit, procurement)

Creates/updates Odoo records safely (least-privilege access)

Keeps full traceability (chatter/logs/activities)

Uses “human-in-the-loop” for sensitive actions (order approvals, credit limit changes, payment actions, etc.)

MVP Scope — 5 AI Agents
1) Logistics Agent (WMS / Pickings)

Prioritize and coordinate pickings (SLA, route, availability, urgency)

Suggest wave/batch picking where applicable and internal replenishment/moves

Create activities, alerts, and chatter messages for responsible users

2) Order Approval Agent

Review sales orders based on rules: stock, margin, exceptions, credit status, etc.

Approve / block / escalate to a manager depending on scenario

Post automated messages inside Odoo explaining decisions and next steps

3) Conversational Sales Agent (WhatsApp)

Communicate with customers via WhatsApp to:

recommend products, answer questions, upsell/cross-sell

build quotations/orders in Odoo (CRM/Sales)

initiate/confirm payment via payment link (based on the chosen provider) and proceed

Log full conversation and transaction traceability in Odoo (customer history, order status)

4) Credit & Collections Agent

Analyze customer risk and payment behavior (aging, history, volume/frequency)

Recommend credit limits/terms (with human approval)

Automate collections workflows: segmentation, reminders, activities, templates

5) Procurement & Replenishment Agent

Recommend purchases based on turnover, min/max, lead time, stock-outs

Review supplier price lists and suggest best options

Prepare RFQs/PO drafts and escalate approvals when required

Technical Requirements

Proven experience with Odoo 19 (configuration + automation; Python/server actions if needed)

Practical knowledge of Odoo AI Agents (agent setup, prompts, topics/sources/tools)

WhatsApp API integration (through a provider/API) mapped to CRM/Sales flows

Strong security mindset: permissions per agent, audit trail, validations/guardrails

Nice to have: Accounting / credit control, WMS experience, procurement planning

Deliverables

Architecture document (agent design, permissions, audit, risks, guardrails)

Permissions matrix per agent + “human-in-the-loop” workflow design

Working MVP of the 5 agents in staging/test environment

Scenario-based tests + acceptance checklist

Operational guide for the team (how to use, monitor, handle exceptions, adjust rules/prompts)

Post-MVP roadmap and scaling recommendations

Required Screening Questions

Have you implemented Odoo 19 AI Agents? Describe a real project and outcomes.

How would you design “human-in-the-loop” for order approvals, credit limit changes, and payment-related actions?

What WhatsApp approach do you recommend (provider/API), and how would you ensure full traceability in Odoo?

Which Odoo modules/features would you use for picking coordination and replenishment planning?

Propose an MVP rollout plan (phases + priorities) and explain why.

Suggested Skills (Upwork tags)

Odoo

Python

ERP Development

API Integration

Workflow Automation

WhatsApp API (Messaging API)

Accounting / Credit Control (preferred)

title: Notion Systems Developer + Slack Automation Expert (Notion Licensable OS Build) Using N8N/Make
description:
We are building a licensable, plug-and-play execution system using Notion + Slack, with integrations from Fireflies, Google Calendar, and voice-to-task capture.

This is not a basic to-do list. It is a company-wide accountability system designed to:

Eliminate task loss after meetings or conversations

Automate follow-ups and reminders

Give leadership real-time visibility across teams

We are looking for a systems-level Notion developer to implement this cleanly and scalably.

Scope of Work
Notion (Core System)

One master task database (single source of truth)

Status flow:
Unassigned → Not Started → In Progress → Blocked → Done → Needs Review → Completed

Automatic This Week vs Backlog views (date-driven)

Leadership, team, and individual views (bi-directional editing)

Integrations (Required)

Fireflies

Auto-ingest meeting action items

Include meeting links / notes

Slack Automations

DM when tasks are assigned

Due-date reminders (48 hrs, tomorrow, day-of)

Notify leadership when tasks need review

Monday + Friday leadership rollups

Voice → Task Capture (Critical)

Ability to speak tasks into Slack or WhatsApp

Voice message is transcribed

Task is automatically created in Notion

Default status = Unassigned / Backlog

Minimal friction for users

Google Calendar

Read-only calendar embedded in individual workspaces

Template & Licensing Requirements

Clean, cloneable Notion template

Built for repeated client deployment

Light setup documentation

Required Experience

Advanced Notion systems (databases, views, formulas)

Slack automations (Workflow Builder, API, Zapier/Make/n8n)

Voice-to-text or conversational input automations

Building reusable / productized systems

Bonus

Fireflies integrations

WhatsApp automation experience

Timeline & Budget

Timeline: ~2–4 weeks

Budget: Open (experience-based)

How to Apply

Please include:

Notion systems you’ve built (not basic templates)

Slack automations you’ve implemented

Experience with voice-to-task or conversational inputs

Tools you’d use to build this

Final Note

We’re looking for a systems thinker, not a task list builder.
If you enjoy building automation-driven operating systems, this is a great fit.

title: Senior Backend Developer – Voice AI + Restaurant POS Integrations (Orders & Payments)
description:
Overview

We’re building AI-powered voice agents for restaurants that can answer inbound phone calls, take food orders, integrate with the restaurant’s POS system, and trigger payment links via SMS.

This is not a chatbot project.
This is a production-grade system that must work with real restaurants, real orders, real payments.

We are looking for a senior-level developer who has experience integrating with restaurant POS systems, APIs, payments, and telephony/voice workflows.

What We’re Building (High Level)

When a customer calls a restaurant:

Voice AI agent answers the call

Agent takes the customer’s order (menu, modifiers, quantities, etc.)

Order is pushed into the restaurant’s POS system

POS (or backend logic) generates a payment request

A payment link is sent via SMS to the customer

Order is confirmed once payment is completed

This must work across multiple POS systems, depending on the restaurant.

Core Responsibilities

You will be responsible for:

Integrating multiple restaurant POS systems (API-based where available)

Normalizing menu data, modifiers, pricing, taxes, etc.

Creating logic to build orders programmatically

Triggering payment links based on the order total

Sending payment links via SMS

Handling webhooks (order status, payment confirmation, failures)

Ensuring the system is reliable, secure, and scalable

POS Systems (Examples – not limited to)

Experience with one or more of the following is a huge plus:

Toast

Square

Clover

Lightspeed

Revel

NCR Aloha

Stripe Terminal / Square Payments (or similar)

We understand each POS is different, and part of this role is handling those differences cleanly.

Technical Requirements

You should have strong experience with:

REST APIs & Webhooks

Backend development (Node.js, Python, or similar)

Payment processing (Stripe, Square, etc.)

SMS APIs (Twilio or similar)

OAuth / API authentication

Handling edge cases (menu changes, unavailable items, failed payments)

Clean, well-documented code

Bonus (not required but helpful):

Experience with voice/telephony platforms (Twilio Voice, Vapi, Retell, etc.)

Experience working with AI-driven workflows

Experience in restaurant tech or POS ecosystems

What This Is NOT

❌ Not a WordPress job

❌ Not a no-code build

❌ Not a “quick MVP” with fake data

This is real infrastructure that will be used by real businesses.

Engagement Details

Ongoing work (not a one-off task)

Starting with 1–2 POS integrations, expanding from there

Open to hourly or milestone-based pricing

Looking for a long-term technical partner, not just a freelancer

How to Apply

Please include:

Relevant experience with POS or payment integrations

Specific POS systems you’ve worked with (if any)

Examples of backend/API-heavy projects

Your preferred tech stack

Any experience with telephony, SMS, or voice systems (if applicable)

Applicants without relevant integration experience will not be considered.

title: Build out Call Center using Twilio API
description:
Overview

We are building and/or enhancing a production-grade outbound dialing system and are looking for an engineer who has hands-on experience developing auto-dialers and dialer control logic (not just basic Twilio call placement). The ideal candidate has implemented multiple dialing modes (predictive, power, aggressive, etc.), understands common dialer configuration parameters, and has built logic around compliance constraints (state dialing rules) and operational controls (retry timing, dialable status gating, pacing).

Tech Stack
Telephony: Twilio (Voice)
Backend: Node.js, Express.js
Database: MongoDB and/or SQL (we are flexible; experience with both is a plus)
Frontend: React

Scope of Work (Expected Capabilities)

We need someone who can design and implement dialer features such as:

Dialing Modes / Pacing
Predictive, power, aggressive (and/or progressive) dialing strategies
Dialing pacing logic based on agent availability and configurable ratios

Call concurrency controls and queue management

ANI / Caller ID Management
ANI groups by campaign, geography, or other attributes
ANI rotator logic (rotation strategies, health checks, cooldowns)
Handling of caller ID reputation considerations and fallback strategies

Compliance / Dialing Rules
State-by-state dialing rules (time-of-day, restrictions, etc.)
Campaign-level constraints and configurable overrides
Logging and auditable decisions for compliance-related gating

Custom Dial Logic / Status-Based Dialing
Lead/contact “dialable status” logic (e.g., wait periods before re-dial)
Retry/backoff strategies based on call outcomes and dispositions
Rules for busy/no answer/voicemail, max attempts, and time windows

Integrations / Operations
Twilio call lifecycle handling: webhooks, status callbacks, error handling
Resilient job scheduling for outbound attempts (queues, workers, retries)
Metrics, monitoring, and reporting hooks (call attempts, connects, agent utilization)

What You’ll Deliver
Dialer orchestration logic (server-side) with clear configuration parameters per campaign
Data model for campaigns, ANI pools, leads, call attempts, dispositions, and rules
Twilio webhook handling and call-state management
Documentation for configuration and operational tuning

Optional: UI components in React for dialer/campaign configuration (if you have full-stack capacity)

Required Experience
Demonstrated experience building auto-dialers or call center dialing platforms
Strong Twilio Voice implementation background (status callbacks, webhooks, call flows)
Backend proficiency in Node.js/Express
Experience implementing pacing/routing logic, retry windows, and dialer state machines
Familiarity with compliance-driven dialing constraints (at least at a technical enforcement level)

Nice to Have
Experience with queue systems (BullMQ, RabbitMQ, SQS, etc.)
Experience with real-time dashboards (WebSockets)
Prior work on agent assist, dispositioning, or CRM integrations

To Apply (Please Include)

A brief description of a dialer you’ve built (dialing modes, pacing approach, how you handled retries and compliance)

Your Twilio Voice experience (what call flows, webhook patterns, and scaling strategies you’ve used)

Any architecture notes (queues/workers, concurrency approach, DB schema patterns)

Links or screenshots (if available) or a short walkthrough of relevant work

Engagement
Start: immediate
Scope: initial build/enhancement with potential ongoing work

title: AI Voice Prompting System Developer (Google Sheets–Driven, Live Audio Environment)
description:
Overview
We operate a live escape room business and already have a working, manual game master prompting system. We are looking to automate that system using AI while keeping a human game master in control.

This is not a chatbot and not a guessing system. The AI must follow a structured flow driven entirely by Google Sheets and game master inputs.

A video is attached that visually explains our current setup and desired outcome. You must review it before applying.

Current Setup (Already Exists)

Each room has:

A screen visible to guests

A physical control panel that triggers in-room effects

Game master station includes:

A Windows-based Fire tablet used as a control interface

A Google Sheets / Google Docs–based prompt system

A headset connected to the room audio

Game masters currently:

Start the game from Google Sheets

Monitor a timer per puzzle

Read clues manually in a themed voice

Click Continue as puzzles are completed, advancing to the next section with new clues

What We Want to Build

We want an AI system that works off the existing Google Sheets structure and behaves exactly how a trained game master would.

Core behavior:

AI listens to the room audio

Detects phrases like “can you help us”

Responds with: “Attention guests, are you requesting a clue?”

If guests say yes, AI delivers the correct clue for the current puzzle

Each puzzle has multiple clue levels the AI must follow in order

Game state control:

AI does NOT decide when puzzles change

Game master visually watches the screen and clicks Continue on the tablet when puzzles are completed

Each Continue advances the AI to the next puzzle section with a new set of allowed clues

AI always stays synced to Google Sheets

Timing logic:

Google Sheets already tracks:

Game start time

Time per puzzle

When time is running low, AI asks if guests want a clue

If guests say no:

AI waits

Adds +2 minutes by triggering the same Google Sheets function we already use

AI never auto-gives clues without confirmation

Game Master Role (Post-AI)

Game master monitors AI and screens

Clicks Continue to keep AI in sync

Can oversee 3–4 rooms at once

Can override AI at any time

Can type a custom response that AI will read out loud

Can instantly shut off AI and take over manually

System Requirements

Google Sheets must be the single source of truth

AI must:

Read from Sheets

Write actions back to Sheets (advance stage, add time)

Audio routing:

AI must speak through existing room speakers

Game masters must also hear AI responses

Tablet-based interface preferred so game masters can walk around

Distinct voice/style per room (5 different rooms)

What to Include in Your Application
When you apply, you must:

Acknowledge the current software and hardware setup described above

Explain what additional tools or hardware (if any) would be needed

Explain how you would technically approach this build

Estimate how long an MVP would take to implement

Generic applications will be ignored.

Goal
If successful, this system allows:

Remote monitoring of games

Reduced in-room staffing

On-site staff focused on resets, greetings, maintenance, and social media outreach

A simple remote role monitoring screens (potentially outsourced)

This is a real, live environment. Reliability matters more than flash.
If you’ve built state-driven systems that integrate AI, audio, and Google Sheets, we want to hear from you.

If you want next:

I can shorten this by 30% for Upwork skimmers

Add a budget range and milestone structure

Or write the application screening questions so only qualified people respond

the screen is not visible to the guest its the game masters

title: Complete a Software Coding Challenge
description:
https://github.com/ryanhugh/coding-challenge-3


Performance Optimization Coding Challenge
This is a performance optimization coding challenge. Your task is to optimize a kernel implementation to achieve the best possible performance, measured in clock cycles from the simulated machine.

Challenge Overview
This challenge involves optimizing a kernel implementation in KernelBuilder.build_kernel. The starter code begins at a baseline performance level, and your goal is to optimize it as much as possible.

Success Criteria
This is a fixed price contract. Success is defined as achieving performance below 1487 cycles.

Your solution will be evaluated based on whether it meets this threshold. Run python tests/submission_tests.py to verify your performance and see which thresholds you pass.

Performance Benchmarks
Measured in clock cycles from the simulated machine:

147734 cycles: Baseline starting point
18532 cycles: Updated starting point from an earlier version of this challenge
2164 cycles: Benchmark threshold 1
1790 cycles: Benchmark threshold 2
1579 cycles: Benchmark threshold 3
1548 cycles: Benchmark threshold 4
1487 cycles: SUCCESS THRESHOLD - Your solution must achieve below this to succeed
1363 cycles: Advanced benchmark threshold
Run python tests/submission_tests.py to see which thresholds you pass.

Important Notes
Do not modify the tests folder. The test suite must remain unchanged. Any modifications to the tests/ folder will invalidate your submission.

If you use an AI agent or assistant, make sure it does not modify the tests/ folder and uses tests/submission_tests.py for verification.

Please run the following commands to validate your submission:

# This should be empty, the tests folder must be unchanged
git diff origin/main tests/
# You should pass some of these tests and use the cycle count this prints
python tests/submission_tests.py
Note: problem.py has multicore support, but multicore is intentionally disabled in this version (N_CORES = 1). Do not attempt to enable multicore as an optimization - it will not provide a speedup and modifying the core count is not allowed.

title: AI SEO Strategist & Workflow Designer
description:
Job Description
We are looking for an experienced SEO Strategist to help us translate a monthly SEO workflow into an AI-driven automation system.

You will act as the SEO subject-matter expert and system designer, providing clear, step-by-step guidance to our internal Solutions Engineer, who will execute the technical build.

Your responsibility is to define what the AI should do, in what order, and with what rules — ensuring the automated system mirrors how a skilled human SEO would operate.

Role Responsibilities

1. SEO Workflow Deconstruction: 
• Break down our existing monthly SEO workflow into precise, repeatable steps [Click file below to view current process]
• Define decision logic, inputs, outputs, and success criteria for each step
• Identify which tasks should be:
- Fully automated
- AI-assisted with human review
- Kept manual

2. AI Agent Instruction & Logic Design:
• Define prompts, guardrails, and instructions for AI-driven SEO tasks, including:
- Website audits
- On-page and technical SEO fixes
- Content and keyword execution
- Internal linking strategies
- Off-page SEO workflows
• Specify quality standards and SEO best practices the AI must follow

3. Tooling & Integration Guidance:
• Recommend SEO tools, APIs, and data sources required for each workflow stage
• Advise on integrations with CMS platforms (Squarespace), GA4, GSC, and other SEO tools
• Help design human-in-the-loop checkpoints before changes go live

4. Monitoring, Reporting & Optimization Framework:
• Define how keyword tracking, indexing checks, and performance monitoring should work
• Outline reporting logic and metrics for monthly SEO reports that mirrors current reporting standards
• Recommend how the system should decide next-month priorities based on performance data

5. Training & Knowledge Transfer:
• Work closely with our Solutions Engineer to explain:
- SEO logic behind each automation
- Edge cases, exceptions, and common pitfalls
- How to scale the system across multiple client websites
- Provide written documentation, diagrams, or SOPs where helpful

Deliverables & Success Metrics: 

Deliverables:
- A documented SEO automation blueprint that mirrors our monthly SEO workflow
- Clear decision logic, rules, and AI prompt guidance for SEO execution
- SOPs and documentation to support handoff to our Solutions Engineer
- Advisory support during the build to refine logic and edge cases

Success Metrics: 
- Reduce ongoing SEO execution time to from 12 hours to ~2 hours per month 
- Maintain or improve SEO performance compared to current human-led processes

Engagement Details: 
- Contract Duration: 60 days (8 weeks) 
- $1,000

title: Video Animation needed with voiceover for company demo
description:
Overview
I need an expert-level motion designer to create a mostly animated marketing video that feels very similar to this reference style (conversation-driven AI voice agent demo):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PFoHsmcF7A8

The video should visually show a phone call conversation between an AI agent and a caller, with on-screen captions and UI animation that make the workflow and transformation clear. Think clean, modern SaaS style, smooth transitions, and strong pacing with voice over.

What we are making
A short, high-quality animated explainer that communicates “call center transformation” using an AI voice agent.
The core structure is a back-and-forth conversation (AI agent speaks, caller responds) while the screen shows relevant UI moments, summaries, and benefits.

Target style
Mostly animation, minimal or no stock footage
Modern UI animation (dashboards, cards, highlights, status changes)
Kinetic typography and callouts that follow the voice-over
Clean vector design, premium feel, not a cheap template look
Light sound design is a plus (subtle UI sounds, transitions)

Estimated length and formats
Primary deliverable: 60 to 90 seconds (we can lock the exact runtime after the storyboard)
Format: 16:9 (1920x1080 minimum, 4K preferred)
Optional add-ons if you can do it: 9:16 cutdown and a 15-second teaser

Deliverables
1) Final MP4 (and MOV if needed)
2) Captions file (SRT) plus burned-in captions version
3) Project files (After Effects preferred) with organized assets
4) Any custom design files (AI, PSD, Figma, etc) used for the animation
5) Music and sound credits or licenses, if you provide them

What we will provide

Reference video link and art direction
Brand logo and brand colors (or we can stay neutral and clean if needed)
Script and rough outline (or you can help refine the script if you offer that service)
Any claims and compliance notes that must be included

What I need from you
Storyboards and style frames quickly, then full animation
Great timing and polish, strong typography, strong visual hierarchy
Ability to animate a conversation-driven narrative in a way that stays engaging the entire time
Clear communication and a tight production process

Timeline and turnaround
This is a fast turnaround project.
Kickoff: immediately after hiring
Goal for final delivery: ideally by February 20, 2026
Hard deadline: February 28, 2026

Please only apply if you can hit this timeline.

Experience required

Expert-level motion graphics and animation

After Effects and Illustrator workflow

Explainer video production experience, especially SaaS, AI, or product demos

Bonus: experience syncing animation tightly to voice over, plus sound design

How to apply

Please include:
1) 2 to 3 portfolio examples similar to the reference style (product demo animation, UI animation, explainer videos)

2) Your proposed production plan with milestones (storyboard date, first cut date, final date)

3) Your fixed price quote (or your hourly rate with an estimated total)

4) What you will need from me on day one to start

5) Confirm you can deliver by February 20, 2026, or by February 28, 2026 at the latest.

title: Integration & Automation Specialist for Insurance Agency
description:
Integration & Automation Specialist
Growing Insurance Agency - Benefits Administration Specialty

Engagement Type: Contract (Part-time to start, potential ongoing)
Duration: 6 months initially (24-week phased project)
Budget: $15,000 to begin
Location: Remote (US preferred for timezone alignment)

About Us
We're a specialized benefits administration insurance agency operating across 12 states. We manage 57+ employer groups with ~1,250 employees and work with 25+ insurance carriers. We also provide white-label back-office services for partner agencies.

We're at a growth inflection point: our expertise and client relationships are strong, but manual administrative work is capping our scale. We need to change that.

The Opportunity
We're implementing a comprehensive automation strategy to streamline our case onboarding and ongoing service workflows. We've mapped our full operational lifecycle - from initial sale through annual renewal - and identified significant time savings through better integration and automation.

You'll help us transform from: Manual data entry, platform-hopping, and repetitive administrative tasks
To: Automated workflows where data flows between systems and exceptions surface for human attention

Tech Stack Overview
We'll share specific platform names after initial conversations and NDA, but here's what you'd be working with:

System Type
Function
Integration Priority
CRM/AMS Platform
Central hub - single source of truth
HIGH - Everything flows here
Benefits Admin Platforms (3)
Employee enrollment & reimbursement
HIGH - Core operations
Payment Platform
Benefits card loading & funding
HIGH - Automate manual processes
Lead Generation Tool
AI-powered prospecting
MEDIUM
Phone System
VoIP with call intelligence
MEDIUM
ACA Enrollment Platform
Marketplace enrollments
LOW


All platforms have APIs or integration capabilities. Some are more mature than others.

Workflow Scope
We've documented our full operational lifecycle - from initial prospect through ongoing client service and annual renewal. This includes multiple phases spanning sales, employer setup, employee enrollment, carrier coordination, and ongoing support.

We'll share detailed workflow documentation after NDA, but you should expect to work across the entire client lifecycle, not just one piece of it.

Initial Project Focus
We need an integrated dashboard and workflow automation system that provides visibility across our full client lifecycle:

Prospecting & Sales - Lead tracking and pipeline visibility
New Business - Signed client onboarding status
Employer Setup - Platform configuration and document completion
Employee Enrollment - Enrollment progress and carrier submissions
Ongoing Service - Client and employee support tracking

The goal is a single view that shows where every client and prospect stands, with automated alerts when action is needed and data flowing between systems without manual re-entry.

What We're Looking For
Must-Have Skills:
Experience with API integrations and middleware (Zapier, Make/Integromat, n8n, or custom)
Ability to work with CRM/AMS platforms
Comfort with payment system automation and financial data handling
Data transformation skills (reformatting files for different platform requirements)
Strong problem-solving skills - not all systems have clean APIs
Clear communication - you'll work directly with our small team (2 people)

Nice-to-Have:
Insurance or benefits industry experience
Experience with employee benefits platforms or HR systems
Python, JavaScript, or similar for custom scripting when needed
Database/reporting experience for dashboards

Mindset:
Pragmatic over perfect - we need working solutions, not elegant architecture
Ownership mentality - flag problems early, propose solutions
Documentation habits - we need to maintain what you build

Working Arrangement
Communication: Regular check-ins (weekly minimum), async updates
Hours: Flexible, estimated 15-25 hrs/week depending on phase
Access: Full credentials and access to all systems after NDA
Decision-making: You'll have latitude to recommend approaches; we make final calls together
AI Collaboration: We use Claude (AI assistant) as a project partner to help maintain documentation, troubleshoot issues, and keep work aligned with our overall architecture. You'll collaborate with both us and Claude to move efficiently.

How to Apply
Please include:

1. Relevant experience: 2-3 examples of similar integration or automation projects you've completed. Bonus points for insurance/benefits, HR platforms, or payment systems.

2. Your approach: Describe how you'd build a dashboard that pulls status data from multiple disconnected platforms into a single view, with automated alerts when something needs attention. (Just a paragraph - we want to see how you think.)

3. Availability: When could you start? How many hours/week can you commit?

4. Rate: Your hourly rate and whether you're open to a retainer arrangement for ongoing work.

Next Steps
Strong candidates will have a brief intro call, sign an NDA, and then receive full details on our specific tech stack and workflow documentation before deciding if it's a mutual fit.

Questions?
Happy to jump on a quick call to discuss the project in more detail.

title: Experienced AI Developer for Sales Agent and CRM Integration

Authentication + access control

Ongoing optimization as we expand modules

Required Skills & Experience

API integration experience (REST, Webhooks)

Ability to read and implement strict workflow logic

Strong communication and documentation habits

Familiarity with automotive workflows is a plus, not a must

Documentation

Contract-based

title: AI-Driven Offer Automation (Scraping + GPT + GHL Publishing)

Direct cruise line websites

Our internal booking data (provided)

Triggered when new offers are published

OpenAI / GPT integrations

GoHighLevel integrations (API, Webhooks, or publishing workflows)

Automated data ingestion & normalization
AI offer-selection pipeline
Publishing system for weekly/monthly offers

Clean, extensible architecture

Not a one-time scraper

This is a backend + automation project.

title: Staff Software Engineer Python & AI Agent Security Platform
description:
About the role

Skyrelis is looking for a Member of Technical Staff (MTS) / Staff Software Backend/Platform Engineer contractor to lead the design and development of cloud-native, Python-first systems that power AI agents, LLM integrations, safety/guardrails, and secure traffic inspection across modern deployments. This is a backend/platform role focused on production systems, security, and reliability. You will work on architecture, core platform services, proxy/HTTP systems, data pipelines, and AI agent runtime controls—shipping production-grade software with high reliability and strong security posture.

Responsibilities
•	Lead system design and architecture for scalable backend/platform services supporting AI agents and LLM-driven workflows.
•	Build and maintain Python services and libraries (APIs, pipelines, policy engines, telemetry, integrations).
•	Develop secure, high-performance components involving:
•	HTTP/HTTPS, TLS, certificates, and request/response processing
•	Forward/explicit proxies, service-to-service traffic interception, and policy enforcement
•	Design and implement guardrails/safety controls for AI agent workflows (prompt/response filtering, tool-use controls, policy checks, data loss prevention patterns).
•	Build cloud-native deployments on AWS and/or GCP, including CI/CD, observability, and cost-aware scalability.
•	Drive debugging and incident resolution: deep dives across app, network, and infra layers.
•	Design data models and storage for operational analytics using OpenSearch/PostgreSQL and related systems.
•	Collaborate with product, security, and infra teams to define roadmaps, technical direction, and best practices.
•	Mentor engineers and raise engineering quality through reviews, design docs, and operational excellence.

Required Qualifications
•	BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
•	7+ years of hands-on software development experience with strong ownership of production systems.
•	Strong background in design and architecture (distributed systems, APIs, reliability, scaling).
•	Strong Python development experience; comfortable with additional languages (e.g., Go/Java/TypeScript/Rust).
•	5+ years of working experience with FASTAPI or any other Python web framework.
•	Working knowledge of AWS and/or GCP cloud deployments (networking, compute, IAM, security).
•	Excellent debugging skills across application, network, and infrastructure layers.
•	Solid understanding of HTTP/HTTPS protocols, TLS, certificates, and traffic flows.
•	Knowledge/experience with proxies (forward/explicit/reverse), authentication patterns, and request/response transformations.
•	Experience with databases and search/analytics systems: PostgreSQL, OpenSearch/Elasticsearch (indexing, mappings, query patterns).

Preferred Qualifications
•	Knowledge of AI / LLM / Agent Technology Requirements
•	Hands-on experience building AI agents using common frameworks (e.g., LangChain/LangGraph, LlamaIndex, Semantic Kernel) and core patterns like tool/function calling, planning/execution, memory, RAG, and multi-agent workflows.
•	Practical integration with LLM services/APIs (e.g., OpenAI/Azure OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Vertex/Gemini, AWS Bedrock) including streaming, structured outputs, routing/fallbacks.
•	Experience implementing guardrails and safety controls (policy enforcement, prompt-injection defenses, PII/secrets detection, moderation, tool-use restrictions; tools like Prompt Guard, Guardrails AI, NeMo Guardrails, LLM Guard, etc.)
•	Strong understanding of RAG and retrieval systems, including embeddings, chunking/ranking, and using vector search (OpenSearch vector, pgvector, Pinecone/Weaviate/Milvus/FAISS).
•	Familiarity with evaluation and observability for LLM/agent systems: quality/safety metrics, cost/token tracking, OpenTelemetry tracing/logging.
•	Experience building security products (DLP, policy enforcement, identity integration, audit logging).
•	Experience with service mesh / sidecars (Istio/Envoy), certificate automation, or SDS/mTLS concepts.
•	Experience with Kubernetes (EKS/GKE), Terraform/CloudFormation, and production operations.
•	Experience with OpenSearch (data streams, index templates, ISM/ILM, dashboards) and performance tuning.

Tech Stack
•	Languages: Python (primary), plus Go/Java/TypeScript
•	Cloud: AWS/GCP, VPC networking, IAM, load balancers, CDN
•	Data: PostgreSQL, OpenSearch, Redis; optional vector DBs
•	AI: LangChain/LangGraph, LlamaIndex; OpenAI/Bedrock/Vertex/Gemini/Anthropic
•	Observability: OpenTelemetry, logs/metrics/traces, dashboards/alerting
•	Security/Networking: HTTP/HTTPS, TLS, proxies, authN/authZ, guardrails

Soft Skills
•	Strong ownership and execution abilities.
•	Excellent communication and documentation skills.
•	Ability to operate independently in a fast-moving startup environment.
•	Comfortable collaborating with engineering, security, and customer teams.

title: Software Engineer – AI-Integrated Learning Platform
description:
About the Role

We are building an AI-integrated web platform focused on guided learning and professional development. The platform serves two primary user groups: learners and educators. Each of these groups are supported by role-specific AI copilots that interact dynamically with site content, user data, and learning outcomes.

We are seeking a software engineer with strong full-stack web experience and hands-on type of AI integration skills to help design, build, and scale this system.

What You’ll Build

A web-based learning platform NOT A STANDALONE MOBILE APPLICATION with authenticated user experiences.

Two role-specific AI copilots:

Learner Copilot: Guides users through study resources, projects, goals, achievements, and progress

Educator Copilot: Surfaces analytics, cohort insights, performance trends, and instructional recommendations

A system where AI can securely pull structured data from multiple areas of the website, including:

1.Learning resources and content

2.User projects and submissions

3.Achievements, grades, and progress metrics

4.User-defined goals and milestones

5.Scalable backend services that support analytics, reporting, and real-time AI interactions

Key Responsibilities

1.Design and implement a full-stack web architecture using modern frontend and backend frameworks

2.Integrate large language models (LLMs) to provide contextual, role-aware guided assistance

3.Build secure APIs that allow AI systems to interact with user data and platform resources

4.Implement role-based access control (RBAC) for learners, educators, and administrators

5.Develop retrieval systems that allow AI to reference and cite platform content accurately

6.Create data pipelines that support educator-facing analytics and insights

7.Ensure privacy, security, and responsible AI behavior across all user interactions

8.Collaborate closely with product, design, and content teams to refine user experience

Required Skills & Qualifications

a. Strong experience building modern web applications (React, Next.js, or similar)

b.Backend development experience (Node.js, Python, or comparable frameworks)

c.API design and integration (REST and/or GraphQL)

d.Database design and management (PostgreSQL or similar relational databases)

e.Experience integrating AI/LLMs into production systems

f.Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) or data-grounded AI systems

g.Understanding of authentication, authorization, and user data privacy

h.Ability to design systems that scale and remain maintainable

Preferred Qualifications

-Experience with educational platforms, learning tools, or analytics dashboards

-Prior work with role-based AI agents or tool-calling architectures

-Knowledge of data visualization and educator-focused reporting

-Experience with vector databases, embeddings, or semantic search

-Familiarity with accessibility standards and inclusive design for web platforms

-Experience deploying and monitoring production web systems

What We Value

-Systems thinking and clean architecture

-A product-oriented mindset- building tools that feel intuitive and meaningful

-Comfort working across frontend, backend, and AI layers

-Strong communication and documentation skills

-Curiosity about how AI can enhance learning without replacing human judgment

Why This Role

You’ll be helping shape a platform where AI is not just a feature, but a core interface for learning and teaching; supporting users at different levels, across different goals, within a single connected web ecosystem.

title: Senior Integrations Engineer
description:
The Mission

You will build the integration layer that connects my platform to the entire production world — exactly like:

👉 https://resolve.ai/integrations

This is not about “just OAuth”.
This is about building production-grade, bi-directional, real-time integrations that power AI-driven incident resolution.

⸻

What You Will Build

You will own the full lifecycle of 30+ enterprise integrations, including:

Observability & Monitoring
	•	Datadog
	•	New Relic
	•	Splunk
	•	Prometheus
	•	Grafana
	•	Dynatrace

Incident & ITSM
	•	PagerDuty
	•	Opsgenie
	•	ServiceNow
	•	Jira Service Management
	•	VictorOps

DevOps & CI/CD
	•	GitHub
	•	GitHub Actions
	•	GitLab
	•	Bitbucket
	•	Jenkins
	•	ArgoCD
	•	CircleCI

Cloud & Infra
	•	AWS
	•	GCP
	•	Azure
	•	Kubernetes
	•	Terraform
	•	Helm

Collaboration
	•	Slack
	•	Microsoft Teams

All of these must support:
	•	OAuth or token auth
	•	Webhooks & event ingestion
	•	Data normalization
	•	Secure storage
	•	Real-time streaming
	•	Replay & re-sync

⸻

What “Done” Means

An integration is considered complete only when:
	•	It can authenticate securely
	•	It can ingest events in real time
	•	It can pull historical data
	•	It can send actions back (ack incidents, create tickets, trigger deploys, etc.)
	•	It is visible in the UI
	•	It is used by AI agents to do RCA and remediation

No mock APIs. No fake demos.
These must work in real production environments.

⸻

Your Responsibilities
	•	Design and implement the integration framework
	•	Build a connector SDK for fast onboarding of new tools
	•	Implement OAuth 2.0, token, and API-key auth flows
	•	Build webhook ingestion pipelines
	•	Normalize data into a unified incident + telemetry schema
	•	Handle rate limits, retries, deduplication, backfills
	•	Ensure enterprise-grade security
	•	Expose integrations via UI + API
	•	Make integrations usable by AI agents

⸻

Tech Stack

You will work with:
	•	Python / FastAPI
	•	Node.js (for some SDKs & webhooks)
	•	PostgreSQL / Aurora
	•	Redis
	•	SQS / Kafka-like pipelines
	•	AWS (ECS, Lambda, API Gateway, IAM, Secrets Manager)
	•	Kubernetes
	•	OAuth 2.0
	•	Webhooks, REST, GraphQL

⸻

Who We’re Looking For

You are the right person if:
	•	You have built real integrations with tools like Datadog, PagerDuty, Jira, GitHub, or ServiceNow
	•	You understand OAuth, webhooks, event streaming
	•	You know how to deal with enterprise APIs
	•	You think in systems, not just endpoints
	•	You care about security, reliability, and scale
	•	You want to build infrastructure that powers AI systems

This is not a junior role.
This is a foundational engineering position.

⸻

Why This Role Is Special

You are not just wiring APIs.

You are building the nervous system of an AI-run production platform.

Every incident, every deployment, every outage, every fix in Adps AI flows through the integrations you build.

This is the difference between a toy AI demo and a real AI that runs companies.

⸻

How to Apply

Send:
	•	Your LinkedIn or GitHub
	•	1–2 examples of real integrations you built
	•	(Optional) Any system design or API work you’re proud of

title: complete AI SMS/Whatsap/Telegram CRM
description:
Project Summary

We are completing an existing privacy-first, mobile-optimized web SaaS called SirenAiX — a discreet CRM and AI-powered messaging assistant designed for independent professionals and boutique agencies who handle high volumes of private client communication.

The core CRM, scheduling system, referral system, and UI already exist. However, the previous development team abandoned the project before completing the SMS, WhatsApp, and AI automation layers, which are the most critical components.

We are looking for an experienced engineer or small team to finish and harden the platform — not rebuild from scratch — with a strong focus on official messaging APIs, compliance, cost control, and long-term scalability.

This is an international product (not US-only) and must be built with privacy, discretion, and platform safety as first-class requirements.

🔹 Project Description
About SirenAiX

SirenAiX is a web-based (no App Store), mobile-optimized SaaS that helps professionals and agencies manage:

High volumes of inbound messages

Scheduling and availability across cities and countries

Client follow-ups and re-engagement

Automation via AI so users are not glued to their phones

The AI acts like a sales and operations assistant — polite, caring, persuasive, and context-aware — while always allowing full human override.

The platform is intentionally neutral and flexible in terminology, allowing users to define their own roles (e.g. provider, therapist, companion, worker, model, etc.).

🔹 What Is Already Built

Web-based CRM (clients, notes, tags, history)

Mobile-optimized dashboard UI

Scheduling & availability system

Basic referral system

Admin foundation and user roles

These systems exist and work, but require enhancements and integration with messaging and AI.

🔹 What Needs to Be Implemented / Completed
1️⃣ SMS Messaging (Official, Compliant)

Two-way SMS via official providers only (Twilio or equivalent)

International support (US, Canada, Europe, Australia, NZ, Asia)

Support users who already have existing phone numbers (no porting)

Web-based inbox for managing SMS conversations

Cost-aware architecture (avoid unnecessary per-message spend)

2️⃣ WhatsApp Messaging (Zero-Ban Approach)

Use official WhatsApp Business Platform only

Strict opt-in, templates, rate limiting, and quality safeguards

Content guardrails / sanitization to reduce policy risk

Web-based WhatsApp inbox

Clear separation between AI replies and human replies

⚠️ Any suggestion involving unofficial libraries, emulation, or policy bypassing will be rejected.

3️⃣ AI Messaging Assistant

The AI must:

Handle inbound conversations like a sales assistant

Track:

New clients

Returning clients

Potential clients who could not be booked

Remember preferences and conversation context

Automatically follow up when users return to a city/region

Work in multiple languages (EN, ES, PT, FR, IT initially; roadmap for CN/JP)

Human vs AI Control (Critical)

Conversation modes:

AI Auto

Human Only

AI Draft (human approval)

Clear UI indicators

Manual override at all times

4️⃣ Dynamic Rules & Logic

Configurable discount rules (e.g. early booking discounts)

Location-aware logic (city/state/region clarity)

Time-zone aware scheduling

Multi-number support for higher-tier users

5️⃣ Referral System (Needs Expansion)

Recurring residual commissions

Referral dashboard (earnings, activity)

Tiered referral logic (future-ready)

Marketing tools:

Auto-generated banners

Shareable graphics

QR codes

Neutral copy

6️⃣ Crypto-Only Subscription Payments

Platform subscriptions paid via crypto only

BTC / USDT (XMR optional)

No custody of user funds

No personal names on invoices

Subscription gating by tier

Grace periods, retries, admin overrides

Clean, non-custodial confirmation flow

7️⃣ Analytics & Metrics

Privacy-safe metrics such as:

Message volume

Response time

Lead-to-booking conversion

Peak inquiry times

Location-based demand

8️⃣ Feedback & Longevity

In-app suggestion box

Issue reporting

Feature requests
This is a long-term product, not a one-off build.

🔹 Technical & Architectural Expectations

Must work with an existing codebase

title: Automation Engineer (Cold Outreach + CRM + Inbound Lead Automation) — Execution Only
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
We’re a fitness e-commerce company building an internal automation system for:
1. cold lead outreach, and
2. warm/inbound lead handling (after-hours)

This is an EXECUTION-ONLY role.
All business logic, lead scoring rules, prompts, outreach copy, and workflows are defined by us. You implement them cleanly and reliably across the approved tools.

IMPORTANT:
Generic/copy-paste proposals will be ignored. Start your proposal with: FS-EXECUTION
(We review manually and prioritize candidates who show real automation experience.)

WHAT YOU’LL BUILD (SCOPE)
PHASE 1 — Cold Lead System (Primary / first milestone)
You will implement an end-to-end pipeline that:
* Scrapes / pulls leads using Apify
* Stages raw lead data in Google Sheets
* Calls the OpenAI API for prompt-based lead scoring (structured JSON output)
* Pushes leads into Instantly for cold outreach, using our campaign rules
* Routes only qualified leads into Monday.com CRM (sales-ready only)

Core rules we care about:
* Lead segmentation (B2B/B2C) is a field only (no guessing beyond our spec)
* Scoring thresholding (discard / nurture / sales-ready) exactly as defined by us
* Instantly rules: stop outreach on reply, bounce, or unsubscribe; sync results back
* Monday rule: ONLY inject leads that meet the qualification threshold; map required fields

PHASE 2 — Warm / Inbound Lead Handling (After-hours)
You will also help implement:
* After-hours inbound call handling using JustCall + an AI voice agent
* Capture caller name/contact + intent + basic qualification questions (per our rules)
* NO pricing quotes, NO inventory commitment, NO negotiation
* Automatically create a Monday task for sales follow-up, including call/chat summary + priority
* Attach transcript/summary where available

APPROVED STACK (NO TOOL CHANGES WITHOUT APPROVAL)
You must work within our existing stack unless explicitly approved:
* Apify (lead sourcing)
* Google Sheets (staging / temp storage)
* OpenAI API (prompt-based scoring; no fine-tuning)
* Instantly.ai (cold outreach)
* Monday.com (CRM + tasks)
* JustCall (calling)
* Gorgias (support/inbox)
* n8n (or similar automation layer)

RELIABILITY REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)
We are not looking for experimental automation. We want predictable, debuggable execution.

Your implementation must include:
* Rate-limit and quota awareness (OpenAI / Apify / Instantly)
* Logging: API errors, failed automations, skipped leads + WHY
* Basic retry strategy where appropriate (without spamming or duplicating leads)
* Dedupe and data hygiene safeguards (avoid duplicate outreach / duplicate CRM injection)
* Clear rollout approach:
 - Phase 1: Cold outreach system
 - Phase 2: After-hours inbound system
 - No full rollout without review/approval

WHAT WE PROVIDE
* Clear automation logic and workflows
* Lead scoring rules and prompts
* Outreach rules + campaign structure
* Defined success criteria
* Direct access to stakeholders for questions/clarifications
(You won’t be asked to invent strategy.)

DELIVERABLES (WHAT DONE MEANS)
Phase 1 (first milestone) must deliver:
* Working cold lead pipeline end-to-end (Apify → Sheets → OpenAI → Instantly → Monday)
* Correct field mappings + qualification gating (only qualified to CRM)
* Error logging + a simple troubleshooting checklist
* Short handoff doc + Loom walkthrough (or equivalent)

Phase 2 (next milestone) must deliver:
* After-hours inbound handling per rules
* Automatic Monday task creation for every inbound interaction
* Summary/transcript capture where available
* Basic monitoring/logging for failures

WHO THIS IS FOR
You are a fit if you:
* Have built real automation workflows end-to-end (not just demos)
* Are comfortable with APIs, webhooks, troubleshooting, and edge cases
* Can follow specifications precisely (execution over opinion)
* Communicate clearly and respond quickly

This is not for:
* AI strategists or prompt theorists who don’t implement
* Consultants who want to redesign the system or swap tools
* Anyone who is slow to respond or hard to reach

BUDGET / TIMELINE
* Initial milestone: $500 fixed-price (Phase 1)
* Timeline: approx. 1 week target for Phase 1 (assuming access is granted quickly)
* Ongoing work available if Phase 1 is delivered cleanly and reliably

HOW TO APPLY
In your proposal, include:
1. 2–3 examples of similar systems you’ve built (what it did + tools used)
2. Which parts you personally implemented (not your team)
3. Confirm you can work execution-only within our approved stack
4. Your availability + typical response time during business hours

title: AI Workflow Systems Engineer
description:
AI Workflow & Matching Systems Engineer (Contract)

Role Overview
Seeking a senior, hands-on systems engineer to take ownership of an existing AI-driven data intake, matching, and reporting system. The system is live and partially functional. This role is responsible for evaluating the current architecture, fixing breakpoints, and extending the system to reliably support semantic search and matching. Determining whether Pinecone or a similar tool is required to achieve the intended outcomes is part of the role.

This is not a greenfield build. The focus is assessment, stabilization, and targeted expansion.

Scope of Ownership
	•	Existing System Evaluation
	•	Audit the current end-to-end system and data flow.
	•	Identify failure points, inconsistencies, and unnecessary complexity.
	•	Determine what changes are required to achieve reliable saving, searching, and matching of AI-generated data.
	•	AI-Generated Data Pipelines
	•	Manage ingestion of structured and unstructured inputs.
	•	Improve consistency and reliability of AI-generated outputs.
	•	Automation & Orchestration
	•	Build, maintain, and debug workflows in n8n.
	•	Implement and improve triggers, retries, logging, and failure handling.
	•	Data Storage, Compounding and & Search
	•	Design and implement semantic storage and similarity search, using Pinecone or a similar vector database if required to meet system goals.
	•	Ensure AI-generated data is automatically saved, indexed, able to be re-indexed with additional data, and retrievable.
	•	Maintain clean schemas and support evolving data structures over time.
	•	Matching Logic
	•	Improve and extend weighted matching logic using semantic search and structured signals.
	•	Ensure match outputs are deterministic and explainable.
	•	Report Generation & Delivery
	•	Fix and improve programmatic report generation.
	•	Handle PDF generation, text extraction, and downstream transformations.
	•	Integrate outputs cleanly into Bubble for internal and client-facing views.
	•	Fix issues within bubble such as adding delete options, fixing displayed information, bettering the system 
	•	System Reliability & Scale
	•	Reduce manual intervention and brittle logic.
	•	Design for long-term reliability and compounding data quality.

Required Experience
	•	Strong Python experience, including working with structured data and JSON.
	•	Hands-on experience evaluating and improving existing production systems.
	•	Hands-on experience building and maintaining workflows in n8n.
	•	Experience designing and operating semantic search systems, including Pinecone or similar vector databases.
	•	Experience working with OpenAI APIs in production environments.
	•	Comfortable working with PDFs as both input and output formats.
	•	Experience integrating backend systems and APIs into Bubble.
	•	Proven ability to stabilize partially built systems and extend them pragmatically.

Working Style
	•	Operates with high autonomy.
	•	Comfortable making architectural decisions and justifying them.
	•	Moves quickly, iterates pragmatically, and documents decisions.
	•	Thinks in systems, not isolated implementations

title: Performance-Based Lead Gen for AI Voice Agents | Service Businesses | Pay Per Qualified Show
description:
Ad Budget: 1,000 per month to start (we pay directly, will scale fast if CAC works)

Stage: Pre-revenue, building a repeatable pipeline

What we do:
We sell AI voice agents and automation to service businesses (contractors, law firms, restaurants, home services, real estate). Typical implementation is 3,000 to 5,000.
We need qualified business owners or decision-makers showing up to discovery calls. We prefer performance-based compensation tied to qualified shows.

Your role

Week 1 to 2 setup

Build a landing page with a hard-gate qualification form (work email, business name, website, role, size, pain)
Set up booking and reminder sequences
Launch campaign with tracking (spend to leads to bookings to shows)
Ongoing weekly optimization
Improve targeting, copy, and audiences
Improve show rate through follow-up
Weekly report with key metrics and next steps
Note: With a 1,000 budget, we start with one primary channel and expand only if results justify.

Compensation
We are open to proposals but prefer performance-heavy structures. Please propose one:

Option A: Small setup fee plus pay per qualified show
Option B: Pay per qualified show only
Option C: Low retainer plus pay per qualified show

Include your recommended numbers and why. If month 1 CAC works, we will scale ad spend to 3,000 to 5,000 per month quickly.

Qualified show definition
Paid only if all are true:

Attends and stays 10 minutes or more
Legitimate business (verifiable website, Google Business Profile, or LinkedIn)
Decision-maker (owner, partner, or ops manager with authority)
Clear need and timeline within 6 months
Budget path exists for a 3,000 to 5,000 implementation

Not qualified
No-show or under 10 minutes
No buying authority
Competitors or consultants
Just browsing or vague need
Explicit no budget

Every call must be logged within 24 hours with company, attendee role, pain point, timeline, and budget path. If it is not documented, it does not count. If 3 or more consecutive disqualifications happen, we pause and review targeting.

No generic proposals.

title: AI Revenue System Builder Needed (GoHighLevel, AI Voice, Automation, CRM Architecture)

How to Apply

Your experience with GoHighLevel and AI voice systems

Your availability and preferred compensation structure
I’m not looking for the cheapest option.

title: Full Stack developer with Voice AI and healthcare expertise - Project Based → Long-Term Opportunity
description:
Summary
We are building AloAi, an AI-driven platform used by dental clinics and dental groups to automate patient communication, scheduling, call handling, analytics, and operational workflows. The platform includes multiple dashboards for clinics, partners, analytics, patient journeys, and internal tools. Our system is a mix of microservices and modularized backend codebases (Node.js), front-end dashboards (React/Next.js), and integrated real-time workflows. Because the product evolves quickly, inconsistencies can appear across UI, UX, data, and backend behavior, and we need a dedicated QA specialist to help us find and fix them.

What We’re Looking For
As a Full Stack Developer with AI Voice Bot experience at AloAi, you will design, develop, and maintain both web applications and AI-powered voice bots that enhance patient and clinic experiences. You will collaborate with product managers, AI engineers, and frontend/backend teams to deliver scalable and reliable solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
• Develop, maintain, and enhance web applications using Node.js (backend) and React/Next.js (frontend).
• Design, implement, and deploy AI-powered voice bots for patient communication, scheduling, and call handling.
• Integrate voice bots with microservices, dashboards, APIs and real-time workflows.
• Collaborate with product, QA, and AI teams to identify and fix inconsistencies across UI, UX, data, and backend behavior.
• Ensure applications are performant, scalable, and secure.
• Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
• Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve complex frontend, backend, and voice bot issues.
• Stay updated with emerging technologies, voice AI, and conversational AI trends.
Required Skills & Qualifications:
• Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with Node.js backend and React/Next.js frontend.
• Experience in AI Voice Bot development.
• Strong knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, and modern frontend frameworks.
• Experience with RESTful APIs, WebSockets, microservices and real-time workflows.
• Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) and deployment practices.
• Familiarity with databases (SQL/NoSQL) and version control systems (Git).
• Strong problem-solving, analytical thinking, and debugging skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
• Experience in healthcare or patient-facing applications.
• Knowledge of Voice Activity Detection (VAD), speech-to-text and text-to-speech technologies.
• Familiarity with analytics dashboards and operational workflow tools.

Project Main Work:
1. Make the sales funnel web dahboards production ready.
2. ⁠Make the DSO and clinic dashboards production ready.
3. ⁠Set up docker on our dev and prod servers and also create security deployments for each server upon startup
4. Unscheduled treatments Dashboard
5. Bugs fixing


Full-Time Opportunity
If the project is completed with high quality and on schedule, we will offer a full-time Full Stack role to continue working new features.

title: real SaaS build + real money logic
description:
Job Title

Full-Stack Developer Needed to Build CPA Partner Portal (Vyral Accountant Connect)

Overview

We’re building Vyral Accountant Connect, a modern CPA partner portal that allows accounting firms to manage client referrals, track commissions, access payroll documents, and collaborate seamlessly with a PEO ecosystem.

This is a real production SaaS build, not a landing page or no-code experiment. We are looking for a strong full-stack developer or small team who understands B2B portals, role-based access, data relationships, and integrations.

What We’re Building

A secure CPA portal where accounting firms can:

Refer and manage client companies

Track referrals, commissions, and payouts

Access payroll and tax documents (W-2s, 1099s, reports)

See real-time status updates on PEO opportunities

Maintain a clean CPA → Firm → Client → Employee data hierarchy

Core Platform Requirements
1. Authentication & Roles

Secure login using Supabase Auth

Role-based access:

CPA / Accountant

CPA Firm Admin

Internal Admin

Each CPA is tied to a CPA ID

Each CPA belongs to a Firm ID

All clients and referrals must be tagged to the Firm ID

2. CPA Firm Structure (Critical)

Firm table (Firm ID)

CPA users mapped to Firm ID

Client companies mapped to Firm ID

Ability to:

Track referrals per CPA

Aggregate totals at the firm level

See which CPA referred which client

3. Referral Tracking & Commissions

Integration with Dub for:

Referral tracking

Attribution

Commission logic

Track:

Referral source

Client status (submitted, quoted, live)

Employees onboarded

Monthly recurring revenue

CPA commission / rev share

Simple payout tracking dashboard (exportable)

4. Client & Opportunity Management

CPA can submit new client opportunities via portal

Store structured data:

Company name

Industry

Employee count

State(s)

Renewal date

Status tracking:

Intake received

Underwriting

Proposal sent

Sold / not sold

5. Document Management (Major Feature)

CPA portal access to client-level documents:

W-2s

1099s

Payroll summaries

Tax documents

Secure document storage & permissions

Ability to filter documents by:

Firm

Client

Year

Download + audit logging

6. Employee-Level Access (Phase 1 or 2)

Ability to associate employees with a client

Employee document visibility (read-only)

Future expansion for employee self-service

7. Notifications & Automation

Status change notifications (email, optional SMS)

CPA alerted when:

Client moves stages

Documents are available

Action is required

Open to AI-generated summaries later

Tech Stack (Preferred, Open to Suggestions)

Frontend: React / Next.js

Backend & DB: Supabase (Postgres)

Auth: Supabase Auth

Referrals & Payouts: Dub

Storage: Supabase Storage or equivalent

Hosting: Vercel / Cloud provider

APIs: REST or GraphQL

Must be clean, scalable, and well-documented.

What We’re Looking For

Proven experience building SaaS dashboards or partner portals

Strong understanding of data relationships & permissions

Experience with:

Supabase

Referral / commission systems

Secure document handling

Ability to think through edge cases & real-world usage

Can help define MVP vs Phase 2

Deliverables

Fully functional CPA Partner Portal

Clean database schema (CPA → Firm → Client → Employee)

Referral & commission tracking

Document management system

Admin dashboard

Deployment-ready codebase

Clear documentation

Bonus (Nice to Have)

Experience in HR, payroll, fintech, or accounting software

Familiarity with PEO or benefits platforms

AI workflow experience (future phases)

Project Type

Long-term potential

MVP first, then ongoing development

Budget flexible based on experience

title: “GoHighLevel + AI Voice Phone Answering & Scheduling System (Emergency Services)”
description:
Project Overview

We are seeking an expert GoHighLevel developer to build a production-grade AI-powered phone answering and scheduling system for an emergency service company in the restoration / water mitigation industry.

This system will handle live inbound phone calls 24/7, perform structured intake, classify emergency vs non-emergency situations, schedule jobs via GoHighLevel + Google Workspace Calendar, and escalate to human staff when required.

This is not a chatbot demo or experimental project. The system will be used in real emergency scenarios and must be reliable, well-tested, and professionally documented.

Core Responsibilities (High-Level)

Configure GoHighLevel workflows and automations

Integrate AI voice agent technology for live phone answering

Implement structured intake and qualification logic

Implement emergency vs non-emergency handling paths

Configure calendar-based scheduling through GoHighLevel

Configure call escalation and fail-safe behavior

Implement SMS/email notifications for internal staff

Store call transcripts and intake data in GoHighLevel

Conduct real-world testing and tuning

Provide documentation and short post-launch support

Technical Environment

GoHighLevel

Twilio (voice)

AI voice agent platform (Vapi, Retell, Bland, or equivalent)

Google Workspace Calendar

Final platform selection may be recommended by the developer with justification.

Important Notes (Please Read Carefully)

A signed Mutual NDA is required before detailed specifications are shared.

Full project requirements, workflows, and operational logic will be provided only after NDA execution.

This is a fixed-price, milestone-based project.

Strong English communication is required, as the system handles live emergency phone calls.

Applicants must have prior GoHighLevel experience.

To Apply

Please include:

Relevant experience with GoHighLevel workflows/automations

Experience with voice AI or call automation (briefly describe)

Which AI voice platform you would recommend for this type of system and why

How you typically handle failure scenarios (missed calls, unclear callers, escalation)

Applications that do not address the above will not be considered.
